oracle.spatial.hadoop.vector.hierarchy

Class HierarchyHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.spatial.hadoop.vector.hierarchy.HierarchyHelper

  • public class HierarchyHelper
extends java.lang.Object

    Provides convenience methods used internally to manage hierarchical catalogs -related tasks

    Author:
    hsaucedo

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String MAPRED_KEY_SEPARATOR
      Separator used in composite keys generated by createMapRedOutputKey(String, String)

      Returns an initialized, empty (no content in hierarchy levels) instance of a HierarchyInfo implementation contained in the configuration.

      Loads the content for the hierarchy levels from fromLevel to toLevel using an initialized HierarchyInfo instance.

      If the given hierarchy index exists and is valid it is loaded to the distributed cache, otherwise the hierarchy index is created for the given hierarchy data paths

      • MAPRED_KEY_SEPARATOR

        public static final java.lang.String MAPRED_KEY_SEPARATOR
        Separator used in composite keys generated by createMapRedOutputKey(String, String)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • HierarchyHelper

        public HierarchyHelper()

    • Method Detail

      • createHierarchyInfo

        public static HierarchyInfo createHierarchyInfo(Configuration conf)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns an initialized, empty (no content in hierarchy levels) instance of a HierarchyInfo implementation contained in the configuration.
        Parameters:
        conf - the job configuration
        Returns:
        a HierarchyInfo instance or null if no hierarchy configuration was found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • createMapRedOutputKey

        public static java.lang.String createMapRedOutputKey(java.lang.String hlName,
                                                     java.lang.String id)
        Creates a key for the given hierarchy level name, feature id which can be used as an output key by a mapper and then read from a reducer
        Parameters:
        hlName - a hierarchy level name
        id - a hierarchy level's feature id
        Returns:
        a composite key

      • getHierarchyLevelsNames

        public static java.lang.String[] getHierarchyLevelsNames(HierarchyInfo hierInfo)

      • getLoadHierarchyFromLevel

        public static int getLoadHierarchyFromLevel(HierarchyInfo hierarchyInfo,
                                            Configuration conf)
        Gets the value of the configuration parameter ConfigParams.HIERARCHY_LOAD_MIN_LEVEL.
        Parameters:
        hierarchyInfo - the current job's HierarchyInfo instance
        conf - the job configuration
        Returns:
        the value set in the configuration or 1 if it was not set.

      • getLoadHierarchyToLevel

        public static int getLoadHierarchyToLevel(HierarchyInfo hierarchyInfo,
                                          Configuration conf)
        Gets the value of the configuration parameter ConfigParams.HIERARCHY_LOAD_MAX_LEVEL.
        Parameters:
        hierarchyInfo - the current job's HierarchyInfo instance
        conf - the job configuration
        Returns:
        the value set in the configuration or the value returned by HierarchyInfo.getNumberOfLevels()

      • getMapRedOutputKeyComponents

        public static java.lang.String[] getMapRedOutputKeyComponents(java.lang.String key)
        Gets the components for a hierarchy level-feature id key created using the method createMapRedOutputKey(String, String)
        Parameters:
        key - the composite key
        Returns:
        a two-element array containing the hierarchy level name first and then the feature id

      • loadHierarchyLevels

        public static void loadHierarchyLevels(HierarchyInfo hierarchyInfo,
                                       Configuration conf)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the content for all the hierarchy levels defined in the current job configuration using an initialized HierarchyInfo instance.
        Parameters:
        hierarchyInfo - an initialized HierarchyInfo. To get an initialized HierarchyInfo call createHierarchyInfo(Configuration)
        conf - the job configuration
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • loadHierarchyLevels

        public static void loadHierarchyLevels(HierarchyInfo hierarchyInfo,
                                       int fromLevel,
                                       int toLevel,
                                       Configuration conf)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the content for the hierarchy levels from fromLevel to toLevel using an initialized HierarchyInfo instance.
        Parameters:
        hierarchyInfo - an initialized HierarchyInfo. To get an initialized HierarchyInfo call createHierarchyInfo(Configuration)
        fromLevel - the minimum level
        toLevel - the maximum level
        conf - the job configuration
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setupHierarchyDataIndex

        public static void setupHierarchyDataIndex(Path[] hierarchyDataPaths,
                                           Path hieararchicalIndexPath,
                                           HierarchyInfo hierarchyInfo,
                                           Configuration conf)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        If the given hierarchy index exists and is valid it is loaded to the distributed cache, otherwise the hierarchy index is created for the given hierarchy data paths
        Parameters:
        hierarchyDataPaths - the paths of the hierarchy data to be indexed. If the hierarchy index already exists it will be ignored.
        hieararchicalIndexPath - the path of the resulting hierarchy index.
        hierarchyInfo - the instance describing the current hierarchy
        conf - the job configuration
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.Exception
